translated: “At that time I was a parrot,
who was a nuisance to others.
I made my bed on a cliff,
not far from the Teacher, the One with the Tuft.

analyzed: sāyam pātañca passāmi  buddham lokagga nāyaka
translated: In the morning and in the evening🔽I saw the Buddha, the Leader of the World.
But I had nothing to give,
to that Worthy One, the Best of Men.

analyzed: piyāla phalam ādāya  agamam buddha santika
translated: Taking a piyāla fruit,🔽I went into the Buddha’s presence.
the Best in the World, the Best of Men, accepted it.
Through the confidence in my mind,

original: Ekattiṁse ito kappe,🔽yaṁ phalaṁ adadiṁ ahaṁ;
analyzed: ekattise itas kappe  yam phalam adadim aha
translated: Thirty-one eons ago,🔽the fruit I gave
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.

analyzed: tayaḥ āsum piyālinaḥ  satta ratana sampannā
translated: there were three Piyāla kings.🔽They were powerful wheel-turning monarchs,
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā piyālaphaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā piyālaphaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Piyālaphaladāyaka recited these verses.

analyzed: piyālaphaladāyaka therassa apadānam dasama  sobhita vaggaḥ cuddasamaḥ
translated: The Story of the Elder Piyālaphaladāyaka is finished.
